title: France's left still struggles to find a candidate for prime minister
summary: The left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire alliance leaders met again over the weekend. While previously suggested candidates, who have since backed down, were key to discussions, three new names were floated.

title: Kamala Harris lumps Trump in with the 'predators' and 'cheaters': 'I know Donald Trump's type'
summary: The US vice president attacked her election race rival on Monday, July 22 after receiving a flood of support since President Joe Biden announced on Sunday he would not be running for re-election and was backing her. Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi endorsed Harris on Monday, stating she was lending her 'enthusiastic support' to Harris' effort to lead the party.

title: Biden speaks for first time since dropping out of election, vows to keep working to end Israel-Gaza war
summary: 'I know yesterday's news is surprising and it's hard for you to hear, but it was the right thing to do,' Biden told his staff during a public phone call from his Delaware beach home where he has been recovering from Covid-19. The President, who is due back at the White House on Tuesday, has vowed to continue working to end the war in Gaza during his final months in office.

title: Kamala Harris smashes fundraising record, raises $81 million in 24 hours
summary: The massive haul, which includes money raised across the campaign, the Democratic National Committee and joint fundraising committees, represents the largest 24-hour sum reported by either side in the 2024 campaign. Harris' campaign said it was the largest single-day total in U.S. history.

title: Deadly student protests in Bangladesh shake PM Hasina's regime
summary: Authorities in Dhaka changed the civil service quotas at the origin of the unrest that has rocked the country since the beginning of July. According to a local daily, 174 people have been killed over the past six days.

title: Ukrainian naval drone attacks force Russian fleet out of Crimea
summary: To escape these increasingly capable drones, Moscow's navy has begun a strategic withdrawal to Abkhazia, a separatist Georgian territory.

title: Netanyahu heads to Washington at a time of huge political uncertainty
summary: After the US president's withdrawal, the Israeli prime minister will walk a political tightrope when he addresses Congress this week.

title: France is still looking for a government. Does anyone care?
summary: During the July 14 military parade, Emmanuel Macron and his guests seemed to be scanning the skies above the aerial acrobatic display, as if searching for a solution to the political crisis. There was no blinding revelation.

title: 2024 US election: Republicans pushed to rethink campaign strategy after Biden's withdrawal
summary: With the US president's exit from the race, Donald Trump loses his most suitable Democratic opponent.

title: Paris 2024: Pogacar withdraws from cycling events
summary: The 25-year-old Slovenian, who won the third Tour de France of his career on Sunday, will not be taking part in the Paris Games, due to 'extreme fatigue.'

title: Macron says France is 'ready' to host Paris Olympics
summary: 'We are ready and we will be ready throughout the Games,' the French president said during a visit to the Olympic Village, four days before the opening ceremony is set to take place on the Seine.

title: Yemen firefighters struggle against port blaze after Israel strikes
summary: Heavy flames and black smoke spiraled into the sky for a third consecutive day following the strike on Saturday – a first by Israel on the Arabian Peninsula's poorest country. The attack came in response to a Huthi rebel drone strike that breached Israel's air defenses, killing one person in Tel Aviv the day before.

title: Which political groups make up France's new Assemblée Nationale?
summary: Most MPs, elected or re-elected on July 7, chose a political group to sit with at the July 18 inaugural session.

title: Russia convicts Russian-American journalist in secret trial
summary: Russian-American journalist Alsu Kurmasheva was convicted of 'spreading false information' by a Russian court after a secret trial, and has been sentenced to 6½ years in prison, according to Russian judicial officials.

title: Awarding of 2030 Winter Games to France hinges on government's financial guarantee
summary: Amidst institutional deadlock, the French government must provide the International Olympic Committee with necessary assurances in a letter before July 24, the day of the final decision on the Winter Olympics host.

title: 'Are there any Parisians left?' Shopkeepers fear Olympics will become 'obstacle' for business
summary: Restaurant owners are complaining about the impact of traffic restrictions in the capital's center ahead of the Olympic Games opening ceremony.

title: Paris 2024: French foreign minister says Israeli athletes 'welcome' at Olympics
summary: Responding to a left-wing MP who had said 'Israeli sportspeople are not welcome at the Paris Olympic Games,' Foreign Minister Stéphane Séjourné confirmed the delegation would be hosted and their security 'ensured.'

title: Yemen's Houthis and Israel exchange fire as tensions rise
summary: Israel struck the Yemeni port of Hodeida on Saturday, killing six people, in retaliation for a drone strike on Tel Aviv the previous day.

title: Trump assassination attempt: Secret Service admits 'most significant failure in decades'
summary: Testifying about the July 13 shooting aimed at former president Donald Trump, Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle acknowledged it as an 'operational failure,' and took 'full responsibility,' amid calls to resign.

title: Why environmental activist Paul Watson was arrested in Greenland
summary: Defenders of the founder of the Sea Shepherd NGO are taking action to prevent his extradition to Japan, where he potentially faces a harsh sentence. They question the timing of the arrest, as Paul Watson was once again targeting a Japanese whaler.

title: Paris 2024: The logistical challenge of catering during the Games
summary: At 14 competition sites in Paris and its neighboring suburbs and regions, Sodexo Live! will have served roughly 13 million meals to athletes, volunteers and spectators by the end of the 2024 Olympics.

title: Overtourism: The island of Bréhat is limiting its number of visitors again this summer
summary: From July 22 to August 23, only 4,700 visitors will be able to access this iconic Breton site between 8:30 am and 2:30 pm, a measure closely scrutinized by the region's other islands.

title: On the front lines of the far right's rise, France's rural mayors are in disarray
summary: These mayors, who do not support the far-right Rassemblement National party, have constituents who have just elected its MPs in parliamentary elections. They waver between despondency and determination.

title: Giorgia Meloni's offensive against public broadcasting
summary: Founded in 1954, RAI is an institution in Italy. After Giorgia Meloni's election in 2022, the public broadcasting group, considered a bastion of the left, faced show cancellations, strategic personnel changes and program restructuring, all seen as part of a far-right cultural conflict under the pretext of promoting diversity.

title: 2024 US election: How the Democratic presidential candidate will be nominated
summary: While Kamala Harris is best placed to succeed Joe Biden, her candidacy will only be confirmed after Democratic delegates vote at the party's August 19-22 convention.

title: From denial to withdrawal: The three weeks that led Joe Biden to pull out of the race for the White House
summary: Weakened by his disastrous performance in the televised debate against Donald Trump on June 27, and gradually dropped by the Democratic camp, the American president finally threw in the towel on Sunday, July 21.

title: Harris faces daunting task of transforming into presidential candidate
summary: The US vice president has seen an outpouring of support in the wake of Joe Biden's withdrawal from the race for the White House. Almost certain to win the Democratic Party nomination, she must now assert her political identity.

title: Hamas announces 'national unity' deal with other key Palestinian organizations
summary: The deal agreed on Tuesday in Beijng will create a model to rule Gaza together once the war ends.

title: Secret Service director grilled in tense congressional hearing over Trump assassination attempt
summary: Kimberly Cheatle acknowledged the agency's 'most significant operational failure' during the attempted assassination of Donald Trump.

title: One year of X: Threads, Bluesky, Mastodon – where do Twitter's heirs stand?
summary: By renaming Twitter 'X' on July 23, 2023, Elon Musk confirmed the end of an era. The multi-billionaire's decision prompted regular users to turn to competing platforms, with mixed success.

title: Paris 2024: Snoop Dogg to carry Olympic torch on opening day
summary: The US rapper will carry the flame on Friday through the streets of Saint-Denis. He will also be a special correspondent for NBC during the Games.

title: Vance questions Harris' legitimacy
summary: Donald Trump's running mate lashed out at the US vice president, who is poised to secure the Democratic Party's nomination in the race for the White House. He questioned Kamala Harris' patriotism, alluding to her Indian-Jamaican origins.

title: The Honduran town slowly submerged by rising waters
summary: Honduras, the second poorest country in Latin America, is suffering the brunt of climate change. The coastal city of Cedeño is already partially submerged by the Pacific, while some rural areas suffer from devastating drought.

title: Andy Murray confirms retirement after Olympics
summary: Now ranked 121st, and playing with a metal hip since 2019, time has caught up with Scotland's Andy Murray, who underwent surgery to remove a cyst from his spine which ruled him out of singles at Wimbledon this year.

title: 2024 Olympics: A medal hope for Japan goes up in smoke
summary: Shoko Miyata, 19, had to withdraw from the Paris Olympic Games as captain of the Japanese gymnastics team. Her crime: Having smoked and drunk alcohol, which is forbidden to under-20s in Japan.

title: Secret Service director steps down after Trump assassination attempt
summary: Kimberly Cheatle announced her decision in an email to staff one day after a hearing before the House Oversight Committee where she faced criticism for failing to protect Donald Trump at a rally in Pennsylvania.

title: Paris 2024: During the Olympics, Paris homeowners' dreams of hitting the 'Airbnb jackpot'
summary: The number of apartments in the capital listed on Airbnb skyrocketed in just one year. The Olympics convinced hundreds of thousands of Parisians to sublet their properties at high prices, but not all found takers.

title: Director of the Super-Novae NGO: 'Objectively, the entire Gaza Strip is destroyed'
summary: Alexandre Chatillon describes survival conditions in the enclave, which he visited in early July.

title: Macron presses against anti-whaling activist's extradition
summary: After Paul Watson, founder of the activist group Sea Shepherd and French resident, was arrested in Greenland under a Japanese warrant, Greens MPs, celebrities, and petitions have urged Macron to call for his release.

title: Spain jails man 18 years for bombs sent to government and embassies
summary: Pompeyo Gonzalez Pascual was found guilty of terrorism by the Spanish court, for having sent bombs to targets such as ministers and the US and Ukrainian embassies in 2022, to push Spain to 'stop supporting Ukraine.'

title: French left-wing alliance proposes Lucie Castets as candidate for prime minister
summary: Castets, a figure unknown to the general public, is the finance director at Paris City Hall.

title: Paris 2024: 'Resistance is the shared history of refugee athletes'
summary: In an interview, Afghanistan's Masomah Ali Zada described the Olympic refugee team, of which she is the mission leader, as an 'example of hope' and 'a symbol of unity.' Thirty-seven representatives will be present at the Games in Paris.

title: Haiti's capital in the grip of gangs: 'We eat well two days a week'
summary: Port-au-Prince is 80% controlled by armed groups who terrorize the population. Several tens of thousands of inhabitants, driven from their homes by these gangs, are crammed into makeshift camps where they suffer from hunger.

title: Paris 2024: French PM says 6 drones per day intercepted near Olympic sites
summary: Gabriel Attal explained that the flying vehicles were often used by 'tourists wanting to take pictures,' but, as they are banned, French air defense staff would 'quickly intercept' them, and their operators would be arrested.
